the gods.  There is some power which has kept me alive these years, and 
though I am scarred and crippled my life was saved.  I have devoted the rest

You can see one image that I have finished upon the wall there.  It is rough,
but it is my first, and I am sure I will improve with time.  Time is all I

once-expansive garden is now wholly overgrown with creeping

of a large grate set in the broken ground. A well-used path

""...the Great War. Most of the cities were razed to the ground
by Hellfire, their citizens slaughtered or driven into the 
surrounding countryside, forced to live in fearful squalor 
while the armies of the Dark One continued their destruction.
The places the least affected by the War were the isolated 
cities-- Daerlon, Silvermere, Goldhome, and the like, as the
Dark One concentrated his attacks upon the centers of strength
from the outset, and even by the time the dark forces were 
finally repelled, they had not yet reached them. The forests of
the Elves escaped wrath, of course, as their obscuring magics
prevented the enemy from penetrating far into the wood. The
Dwarves had but to shut their impenetrable iron doors and let
the tides of Orcs pound themselves senseless against them. The
Kang simply stayed in their swamps, as any evil force who 
entered had not only to battle the hostile swamp, but the
clever guerilla tactics of the Kang warriors. The other races,
however, suffered greatly, their numbers decimated by the

[0;32m""What you have just witnessed,"" he says, ""was the capture and confinement of  the soul of Commander Markus within his very own skull. By my power, his life essense now will fuel your own, and he will remain trapped and in agony for eternity within.""[s

[0;32m""While you wear this ring, his life force will be tapped, and will aid your wounds in healing. It is but a simple bauble, but greater rewards may be given for greater tasks.  [32m""But of course, you are the one who completed that minor task with the fool

""King Yeshuz is mad.  I stand here writing what may be my last testament to
 the horrible crimes being commited outside, in hopes that anyone finding this
 may learn from the deadly curse our mad king has brought upon us.  Our King 
 was not always an evil man, and never a madman, but ever had a lust for power 
 and glory.  A warrior-king he was, proud and mighty, worthy in battle and just
 in rule.  In the end, however, his greed overcame him, and as his victories in
 battle increased, his happiness waned.  He began to consult with untrustworthy
 wizards, but for a long while he was unable to find what he sought.  Failure
 after failure left many wizard heads impaled on the gates to the Royal Palace.
 Finally, to our dismay and doom, the necromancer Zorastra came, and her beauty
 and power awed Yeshuz.  Together they probed the secrets of life and death,
 searching for that which the King forever sought-- immortality.  

 It is not known whether or not Zorastra intentionally betrayed Yeshuz.  One
 night, she and King Yeshuz went to the museum in the centre of the city, the
 only place where the spell of great power could be cast-- Zorastra planned to
 drain the energy of the entire city to power a portal to the outer planes, and
 this necessitated a central location.  Once there, the Necromancer queen began
 her dread spell, and the entire city bend under her magical yoke.  With a 
 blinding flash of light, a dark portal snapped into being, and the demon lord
 Goru-Nezar stepped out.  Little did they realize what a scourge they had let
 free into our world!  Zorastra, overconfident in her power, commanded the 
 demon lord to reveal to them the secrets of undying existance.  With a 
 horrible sneer, he granted her wish.  Raising his hand, he pointed at her, and
 a dark beam speared forth.  King Yeshuz watched in horror as Zorastra's body
 began to decompose, completely rotting away within a few moments!  Goru-Nezar
Ƚ'7532"
477,1,0," then trapped hey soul in the undead form of a shadowraith, thus fulfilling her
 with for immortality-- if not in the manner she expected.  Yeshuz, horrified
 beyond all explanation, turned to flee, but the great demon lord grasped him
 with his ungodly strength and hurled him screaming through the dark portal. 
 
 All this time, I had been aware of these happenings, and watched with dismay
 through my scrying orb.  Now Goru-Nezar noticed me, looked straight at me
 through the orb, and laughed.  With a flick of his hand, my crystal ball
 shattered, and I was left bleeding from many cuts.  This was two days ago. 
 Since then, the demon lord has been widening the portal, increasing its power
 so as to allow his unholy horde of demonic warriors to pour forth and ravage
 the city.  I know they will not stop there, like a plague they will scour the
 land, destroying all trace of life and goodness they encounter.  Already much
 of the city has been destroyed by the ravenous demons, and only a handful have
 entered through that accursed portal.

 My time here is waning.  It is only a matter of time before the demons find 
 this concealed chamber and destroy me.  I have tranported the holy master of
 the temple to me, and together we will attempt to attract the mercy of the
 gods.  We stand together in a circle of protection of my fabrication, so for
 a short time we are safe.  Our prayer will be for the gods to blast this city
 into nothingness-- anything less may mean the escape of these unholy horrors,
 and in a few short hours no-one will be left.  These few words will be my
 last, as it is now time to begin our lengthy prayer.  May the gods have mercy
 on our souls.""

  Kale and the high priest of the city halted the destruction, but at a price--

  power and annihilated every moving thing in the city, which was consequently
  blasted and cursed.""

975,0,0,"[0mThe alchemist sniffs haughtily, saying:

[32m""Yes, the swamp! Don't tell me you didn't NOTICE it on your way here. Don't be
 ludicrous! That foul swamp is a blight on the face of this land. Hrmph. A good

[0;32m""DEMONS. Foul abominations from beyond this plane infest our very mines! Only

 when they attack. The normal creatures that lurk in the mines, we have little
 trouble with-- the dwarves of Khazarad are mighty warriors. But these hellish
 creatures scoff at plain iron, as it glances off of them like rain off of a
 duck's back. It is a troubling problem. Many of our finest fighters have been
 slain, their bodies defiled and consumed. It is an outrage!""

[0;32m""Even my champion, the legendary hero Gudruk, was finally defeated. He lies now

 mithril mines. Naturally, great efforts were undertaken to loosen it from the
 wall's grasp, but it did not come. Finally, under the incredible pressures
 we applied, it cracked. A brilliant blue light flashed out, and a thunderclap
 made us all reel in pain. From the shards of the gem smoked out a wispy mist,
 which began to spin and whirl in a vortex. After a moment, it had formed a
 sort of oval disc about ten feet tall. Much to our surprise, a minute later a
 horrible nightmare creature stepped out of it! The rest, as they say, is 
 history. More of the demonic beasts poured out of the portal, and more dwarves
 went to fight them. It wasn't going so bad until IT appeared. Massive and 
 hideous beyond all explanation, it was shrouded in an otherworldy darkness
 that brought fear into the hearts of even the strongest warriors. I was the
 only one who could face it, and when I did, even my keen mithril axe was
 turned aside by its demonic skin. Terribly wounded, I nonetheless managed to
 make it back to the upper mines, where I was brought here.""

""That greater demon is a scourge to the mountain. I fear that it is waiting 
 down there, accumulating its power so that it can attempt a massive strike to
 wipe out our city. The unreasoning hatred these demons display is unmatched,
 they give no quarter nor do they ask for any. And if my own [0;1;32mmithril[0;32m axe could
 not harm their lord, then I have no hope for what may.""

 cannot even send down my Avatar to perform her duties, which is a sore blow to

 darkness is escalating.""

 thousand facets. It reflects the need for eternal vigilance and the myriad
 forms that righteousness can take. The fourth and final artifact is the Spirit
 of the Storm, and it represents both the lightning-swift judgement and the
 righteous fury of the agents of Justice.""

Ƚ'7532"
1416,0,0,"[0mWhen the light in the sky flies once again this shall be a sign of the Dark
One's return. The light is of such beauty that it appears with the grace of a
bird, and is given the name Phoenix. The light of such elegance that many a man
fell to his knees in awe of her.

For the Phoenix represents the rebirthing of the ages. The ages come and go but
the light remains. It is this bond that links all the events of this reality. 
It is the change and the growth of all beings. It is the power that challenges
us to change, and forces us to understand. For it is the universe's tool of
change, and is a tool of great power.

Towards the end of the last Great War, the great light vanished, gone from the
world of mortals, until the time when the darkness would rise again.

For the Dark One knew of the Phoenix and knew if he were to catch her that
this would be a testament to his power and a challenge to the other gods. The
Dark One had long been beguiled by the beauty of the Phoenix and became
obsessed with a desire to possess her.

The great Legends knew of the desires of the Dark One and requested of the 
Phoenix to assist them in their quest to defeat the Dark One's Armies. The
Phoenix, knowing of the danger that the Dark One represented, agreed in
assisting them in their battle against the Lord of Shadows.

For many months the Legends managed to distract the Dark One with the Phoenix,
until he became obsessed enough to divert his Avatar away from Silvermere and
towards the Phoenix's home, The Stronghold of the Templars of Golden Light, an
ancient society of warriors who gave themselves to the Phoenix as guardians of
her and her ultimate destiny in the realm.

There the Dark One's Avatar besieged the fortress in a futile attempt to
capture the Phoenix. While this occurred, it gave opportunity to the Legends to
bring their scattered forces to bear on the Dark One. Unfortunately, on the eve
of the Legendary Heroes' assault, The Dark One, who had grown furious at Ƚ'7532"
1416,1,0,"Avatar's failure, intervened and violated a sacred law of the realm, using
ancient technology long lost and forbidden in the realm. He succeeded, 
breaching the walls of the stronghold and overwhelming the Templars, who in the 
heat of the battle were unable to stop many of the dark one's heroes from
entering the Phoenix's lair. 

Many of the Legends, knowing that they had failed the Phoenix, retreated with
their forces back to Silvermere to await the final conflict with the Dark One's
Avatar. Orfeo Talespinner remained with a small band of his henchmen and
managed to fight his way into the catacombs where the Phoenix lair was located.
Orfeo to this day speaks not of this experience, only knowing the pain of his
failure in stopping the Dark One's army from taking the stronghold.

With the destruction of the Stronghold, the Dark One's Avatar turned his
attention to the great city of Silvermere, his last obstacle in conquering the
realm. Little did he know that the Legends had been given the time to bring
their fragmented armies together. Forces of Light from across the realm had
signed an alliance to either defeat the Dark One or be vanquished in the
attempt.

At this last battle the Legends defeated the Dark One's Avatar. The great mage
Morukai, using magics bestowed upon him by the gods to counterbalance the Dark
One's forbidden intervention, countered many of the Avatar's unholy protective
powers. Vulnerable and surprised by the combined forces of the Armies of Light,
the Dark One's Avatar was overrun and destroyed by Dorshar Lightblade and the
other legendary heroes who still survived. 

This resulted in the beginning of a new age, the Age of Tranquility. With the
Dark One's power temporarily broken, the hosts of shadow fell into disarray and
were scattered about the land like chaff on the wind. The armies of light, 
decimated by the terrible war, returned to their homelands to rebuild and begin
Ƚ'7532"
1416,2,0,"the process of healing the scars wrought during this time. Only time would
will tell the fate of the realm, as the forces of darkness slowly regathered
to fuel the Dark One's unrelenting hunger to control the realm.

2608,0,0,"[0mDespite countless minutes of painstaking translation, you find nothing that 
will help you in your quest. However, the book has many pages, and further
study may yield something of benefit.
Ƚ'7532"
2609,0,0,"[0mAfter some time of fruitless translation, you suddenly come upon a short 
passage detailing a part of the history of the pharaoh:

[0;36m""...It was only after the pharaoh had exhausted the quarry's supply of 
 sandstone did he make the decision to delve further into the mountainside.
 Long did the slaves labour under the burning sun to carve out more stone 
 blocks for the pharaoh's pyramid, and many perished under the cruel whips of
 the overseers. Winding tunnels had pierced the quarry walls, delving deep 
 into the rock, when they came upon the ore.

 Blood-red it was, and harder than steel. When the overseers first reported
 the metal to the pharaoh, he immediately was overcome with lustful images of
 his armies wielding strong new weapons. He doubled the number of slaves, and
 set them to mining this new ore. So great was his want for the strange metal,
 that thousands died and were dragged outside for the carrion-birds to devour.
 Tensions rose as even the strongest slaves began to weaken from malnutrition
 and abuse. Finally, one day, as the pharaoh was personally overseeing the
 mining operation, an angry slave picked up a jagged chunk of the red iron ore
 and flung it at the pharaoh.

 What happened next was a shock to everyone. All knew that the pharaoh was a 
 mighty wizard, and many had perished while attempting to slay him. Normal
 weaponry simply would not harm him, as he was cloaked in a magical barrier.
 However, when the chunk of red ore struck the pharaoh in the head, he reeled
 backward, blood dripping from a deep cut. For what seemed like an eternity,
 all froze in shock and horror. Then, suddenly, incredulous that he had been
 harmed by a mere slave, the pharaoh unleashed a storm of flame upon the slave
 that incinerated him on the spot. Their daze broken by the magical
 destruction of their comrade, the other slaves immediately began stoning the
 pharaoh with shards of the red ore. 

Ƚ'7532"
2609,1,0," In a bloody fury, the pharaoh called upon his immense magical powers. Demonic
 magic swirled about the chamber, causing all who viewed it to stop what they
 were doing and quiver in terror. With a triumphant, bloodthirsty cry, the
 pharaoh completed his spell, and vanished.

 For a moment all thought he had simply left. Abruptly, however, a rumbling
 far beneath the earth rocked everyone off of their feet. The rock at the far
 end of the chamber split open with great violence, revealing a hideous dark
 abomination! The pharaoh, in his indignant hatred, had summoned a nether
 beast to devour all who remained in the mine.

 It is at this point that I turned and ran for my life. The sound of horrified
 slaves and overseers being devoured will haunt me for the rest of my life.
 Once a cruel overseer, I now am a simple monk who lives in penitence for my
 former crimes. Perhaps I was the only one who survived to tell this tale. 
 May God have mercy on their souls.""

""While you were pursuing this information, I cast my eye about the land in
 search of secrets that would aid your quest. And by the grace of the gods, I
 found that which I sought. The first, and most important, is that the pharaoh
 has long been possessed by an evil spirit. The details I obtained were not
 exact, but even since those ancient times he has been a puppet for a powerful
 spirit from an outer plane. This spirit is the cause of his great power, and
 perhaps his vulnerability to that red ore. I believe that this will be the
 key to defeating him. The quarry in which the red ore is located is to the
 southwest-- perhaps after obtaining the ore, the dwarves of Khazarad could
 forge a weapon out of it for you. The second piece of information that I 
 found is that all entrances to the pyramid have long ago been sealed. There
 is no known way to remove these seals. However, there once were secret 
 underground tunnels that were connected to a temple of the Dark One, and they
 may lead into the pyramid. However, I could not find anyone who knows where
 this temple is located! Only one vague rumour was revealed to me-- that one
 priest, hundreds of years old and cursed with the 'gift' of eternal life and
 suffering by the Dark One, still roams this land. Perhaps he, if he has not 
 been rendered insane by the Dark One's power, could be persuaded to reveal
Ƚ'7532"
2612,1,0," the secret entrance to the forgotten temple.""

2948,0,0,"Aldreth glances at you and says, ""Indeed thou might be mightful enough to
pass the test I have."" He pauses for a second then continues ""Very well, deep
inside the dark cave that is in this forest, thou will find many goblins and
orcs. Half way through thou wilst find a trapdoor that will take thee to a
pen of pitiful kobold slaves. At the end of the pen is a cruel lord over
these pathetic slaves, and through his throne thou will find a massive area
full of orcs that have been training and preparing for a grand invasion of
the forest, nay Silvermere."" He pauses for a moment allowing you to take in
the gravity of the situation, then continues. ""I charge thee, adventurer, to
go to this great training area, and return from there fifty orcish HEADS.
When thou dost this proves thee worthy of the combat manuevers used by
warriors of legend."" He goes back to his normal stance, and says
""Return to me when thou hast the heads, until then I bid thee good fortune.""
Ƚ'7532"
2949,0,2950,"Aldreth smiles and says ""Indeed you have passed the test to prove thy worth,
now let me pass on one of the secrets of combat that I have carried with me""
He leans forward and gestures for you to do the same, his voice whispers into
your ear ""There is a technique many great warriors used to attack a foe by
using their weight to force the opponent to the ground, it is a very powerful
blow that you deliver and not only is the damage great but the chance to SMASH
them and knocking them down is great as well. Let me give you an example"",
and before you know it you are on your back staring up at the chuckling face
of the old warrior. He gestures for you to get up and practices with you some
more, as you begin to think you're getting the hang of it he claps his hand
on your back and says ""Indeed thou hath mastered this form of combat, I pray
thee use it in good faith and may your battles be won!"" With that he waves
goodbye to you!

He waits patiently for your response.

your ear she says to you:
""Ah yes Aggie knows of the glare of midnight, a glorious weapon. Long ago the gypsy would not show obvious signs of being armed, carrying only knives, most were thrown, making them more damage, and landin' blows far more easily. The midnight glare were knives of Aggie's family, each layed with a powerful magic, to both seek out a target, and to return instantly to whoever had thrown it.""
The old woman's eyes begin to gaze far off, remembering long ago, ""While carrying multiple knives was a much faster method of combat, often the gypsy would run short on knives, the glare made it possible to carry a single knife.""
Aggies milked over eyes look back upon you, ""There are glare still in existance, I care for several in fact.""

glare was said to be the birthright of a gypsy who had proven themself.""

Ƚ'7532"
4022,0,0,"A look of nostalgia crosses her wrinkled face and she says to you,
""Come young one, let Aggie pass on to ye the legend.""
The old woman walks with you shortly away from prying eyes, then takes a small blue stone from a pouch:
""Many years ago gypsies roamed this land, bringing joy to all that passed, and often defending the traders from the bandits who believed this to be a good spot for an ambush. As time passed by the great war pushed into this area, the gypsies with a true heart for good fled, some deep into the desert, others into the swamps to the west. Many settled in an area around thy grey temple, in dire times the grey will protect any it can, even the white. Soon after something strange happened, a lonely beast wandered into camp, its head always staring at the ground, we thought it no harm. When two children fed it however the thing looked up, dooming the entire camp.""
As she speaks she tries to hold the tears back, but at this point begins to weep longingly:
""The gods had given it a heavy head, as protection for those who wandered near, its eyes killed whoever it glanced upon instantly, its way of turning normal food into the poison that it lived upon. To the gypsies however it was a horrid thing, their bodies crumbled beneath them. Aggie do not desire revenge, what is done is done, their fortune was poor, and the beast meant no harm. If the beast was enchanted by some dark power I doubt any would live through the battle, friend or foe. If Aggie can fashion something that will save those who done it from the glance, but I will need the eye. If ye be either brave or foolish I bid you can get one for me, please I beg you. This will serve to prove yer worth and grant the birthright that belongs in your hands.""
She smiles, somehow confident in you, and walks back towards the others in the camp.

Ƚ'7532"
4033,0,0,"The old man gazes at you, at first showing no reaction, then he starts laughing, a laugh twinged with insanity and hope. ""At last ye came, I hoped word would reach me short friend in Rooder, and it looks as though it has.""
A look of concern crosses his sleepless face and he hands you an obsidian key. He clasps his hands over yours, as if to ensure the safety of the key. ""This key is the only thing standing between the [0;1;32mdemoness[0;32m and her freedom, guard it with yer life, or doom us all."" His hand shaking he points out his door, ""Before ye is a task no one can envy, you must slay the madman in the war-room, I once knew him as a friend but his foley has brought this fortress, our very order at risk. temple resides."" A long, ragged sigh escapes him ""We were never able to destroy it, so this fortress was built, ages ago, to contain it."" His eyes grow wild for
a moment. ""Quickly ye must hurry, even now she knows of ye, and is summoning her
minions, use the key, and slay her, [0;1;32mreturn[0;32m to me her head when ye be through!"" He then starts to break down, sobbing hysterically.

Ƚ'7532"
4034,0,4041,"[0m

Ƚ'7532"
4035,0,0,"He shakes his head quickly, madness threatening to take control. ""I dare not say her name, but for many ages the [0;1;32mOrder[0;32m of the Crimson Flame has been sworn to guard this keep, in this prison of hers for eternity."" Tears streak his face and you are shocked by how brittle this man's mentality is, considering him a high-rank among those known for great willpower. ""It be the duty of many an Inquis'tor to serve time at this place, ours is struggle against forces such as her. Our order was formed to purify magi evils where we could, or imprison those we could not. The keep by Verstaag, near Arlysia houses such a foe. The fortress in the Swamp of Tharollok also contained a foul kang diety, though I heard his followers aided with demon-spawn freed it."" 4051,0,0,"She gives you a curtsey, that almost seems naughty. With an impish smile she says to you, ""Good day traveler, you may call me Madame Alexia,"" She chuckles a moment adding, ""Though I am not quiet a Madame, I soon hope to be to fund my other projects, seems to be the only way a girl can make some coin in these parts."" She then gives you a bit of a serious look, ""I'm actually a bit of a traveler, though I'm more or less [0;1;32mlost[0;32m now, but I am a bit of a historian."" She gives another curtsey, ""Should you ever wish to hear a [0;1;32mstory[0;32m, I would be glad to oblige."" 

Ƚ'7532"
4052,0,0,"Alexia smiles and contemplates you with her penetrating sapphire
eyes. ""Very well, I shall tell you the story, as I've compiled it. Perhaps some day I'll make something of it, but for now, it shall only be known to myself and you. Taking a lecturing tone unusual for one in her field, you're sobered by the weight of the words she begins to speak.

""Ages ago, a time of great peace filled the realm. This was the Age of
Prosperity and existed because a true balance between good and evil had
been reached. The few skirmishes that occurred were trivial, personal matters
and the consensus of citizens of the realm was that they felt safer than they
ever had before. Silvermere was experiencing success and growth greater than any other period in its history while alliances among all races were forged. It surely was an age of prosperity for all. Unfortunately, this could not last; prophecies, long since forgotten, predicted that the power balance would change, and change it did.

""Rhudar was a bustling town full of economic wealth during the Age of
Prosperity and its population was rapidly growing to rival Silvermere's.
Its temple, perceived by the realm to be honoring the codes and treaties
of the time, taught the ancient rituals of magick to any willing and devout
adventurer who applied. This alone helped increased the popularity of the
city. Unbeknownst to all, a calculated and growing evil was festering
within. The Grandmaster of the Shadow Fist Temple had grown more than
weary of his limited powers.""

Alexia pauses and takes a deep breath. Your heart sinks to hear a sad note in her voice as she continues speaking,
""Whether the matter is understandable as mere lust for power, or the
Grandmaster truly failed to appreciate that balance leads to prosperity,
is academic. Thus began the end of the Age of Prosperity and the
Ƚ'7532"
4052,1,0,"transformation of the Shadow Fist Temple to an evil brotherhood possessed by greed, lust for power and ultimate domination of the realm. Working with a malefic diligence, the Grandmaster ordered the brotherhood to cull ancient documents and knowledge of dark magick from the realm. No one suspected his motives and no request for long-forgotten scrolls was denied.
It is the nature of evil to take simple agreement for weakness and it made
the Grandmaster impudently proud of the mass of information gathered by
his minions. He began to train a warrior to carry out his imminent conquering
and named his choice the Dark One's Avatar.

""While the haughty Grandmaster assumed his actions went ignored, one man
in the realm felt the tipping of the balance scale. Dorshar Lightblade, a
human and a witchhunter by profession, may have been the most balanced soul to
have ever existed in the realm. It was the Phoenix, Bel-Lai, the embodiment of
divine equilibrium, which selected Dorshar, and which instructed and
charged him to devote his life and energies to a golden mean of balance. Neither
side in the struggle for good and evil should gain too much power.
Domination by one side or the other would lead to destruction of the realm. Neither good nor evil could exist truly without the other. Dorshar worked quietly, remaining a passive observer, mindful that his own interfering within the realm might be as disruptive of balance as any overt attempt of good or evil. When he discovered the scheme of the Grandmaster and informed the Phoenix, immediate action was necessary. Battles raged for years, yet the Grandmaster's strength increased. Dorshar, alignȽ'7532"
4052,2,0,"ed with the unprepared followers of good, valiantly resisted. Then, at the darkest moment, the Dark One's Avatar moved to gain control of the Phoenix herself, to obtain ultimate power for the Grandmaster. Dorshar led the Templars of the Golden Light, a holy order sworn to protect the Phoenix, against the seemingly unstoppable Avatar. Tragically, it appeared to all that the Grandmaster would succeed in his corrupted plans.""

Alexia's eyes wistfully twinkle now and your spirit lifts with hers as she
completes her tale.
""Bel-Lai had not though, existed for eons without learning a trick or two
herself. The Phoenix determined that avoiding the destruction of the
realm, even at the cost of her own liberty warranted sacrifice. She entreated
Morukai, a mage of legendary renown, to imprison her in a manner to keep
her from the clutches of the Grandmaster. Although this was accomplished
successfully and the Grandmaster was stopped in his quest for ultimate
domination and power, the Age of Prosperity was now only a memory. To this
day, the scales of good and evil tip precariously back and forth with new
threats to it constantly. Only the actions of new adventurers will
determine what fate has in store for the realm.""

Looking back into your eyes Alexia smiles, sees that you understand, and nods approvingly.

4306,0,4307,"Hiryuu:4308

Ƚ'7532"
4307,0,0,"Though the man glances up from his drink, you still see very little of him, he waves you away, ""You are not [0;1;32mHiryuu[0;32m, I wait here for him.""

Ƚ'7532"
4308,0,0,"The man takes a long swallow of his drink before beginning, ""Several years ago I came across an interesting fellow in a bar. Hiryuu was his name, and he was of a most interesting race. His skin was a shade of blue more akin to a flowers petal then to skin, and his eyes were completely green like the leaf of an apple tree. He was very fit, but for such a powerful looking individual he wore very little armor, merely a loincloth and a strange leaf-like headdress that seemed to sprout from his forehead. 
We sat side by side for a long time before I spoke to him, but once I did, his eyes seemed to lock to mine in an eerie stare. I asked him what he was exactly, he simply said that he was a traveler. After some talking I learned he was some type of great warrior, though his race is still unclear, if there are more like him I hope they are as charitable. We quickly became comfortable with one another, and he began to tell me the most bizarre of stories.
He told me that long ago his race sprung from the earth, but they emerged into a barren world. They created forests, rivers, mountains, and swamps out of the love of life and beauty. However the world did not have the energy to support this influx of life, so some areas were left natural, deserts. His race feared these areas and created great castles in every desert around the world to guard the earth from some unspoken power.
Among these he said the castle ruled by one named Nahr was the grandest. It's beauty was unmatched by any other mortal creation, and it housed the greatest knowledge and power of any single place in existence. Nahr was a mighty ruler and champion, but he craved power and was corrupted by the deserts negative energy. He took pleasure in looking across the scorching desert and the tricks the heat played on his eyes and he began to obsess with the power of illusions. His minions followed him in this corruption, and soon they rebelled from the peaceful orders of his race.
Ƚ'7532"
4308,1,0,"Their power was dreadful and forced Hiryuu and others to take action against the illusion weavers of Nahr. The illusion weavers were powerful, but were cut down quickly by the skilled warriors. However when Hiryuu came to the great castle he refused to destroy it, he chose instead to banish it beneath the sands of time for all time.
However, Hiryuu told me that recently he has noticed the dark powers collecting in the desert were causing the castle to come dangerously close to resurgence. He seemed almost pleased though, he told me that if one were powerful enough that great power could be found inside the castle. He even told me that the base of the castle contained great tests of skill for a chosen few to prove there worth of the ultimate training.
I miss my friend Hiryuu these days; it seems he left for the desert, he told such good stories when he drank too much. The funny thing is he drank through his hands, ah well, at least it looked like he did after a few too many ales.""
With that he goes back to his drink.

Ƚ'7532"
4757,0,0,"""Hello, Hello! My now isn't it a mighty fine day for some fishing, aye? I'd get me long pointy boat and go'a hollerin' down the waves in search of a great flusterin' seabass! Do ye e'er go'a fishin? Of course ye do! How can ye resist those tempt'ush waterin's of that hidden lady o'the seas? Eh?"" He slaps you mightly on your back, startling you. You feel a slight tug at your pockets, but when you look, you see nothing. ""Aye, aye. But today I be hear a'servin my fine fishies. And what a catch wor' they! Here ye've got some broiled fishin's, and here there be some boilin' soups, and over here, mine personal favor'eet, fish and chips! Aye, matey ye'll have never tasted finer fishin' in all the lands. Shh, can I let ye in on a little secret? The chips are potatoes! Now don't be tellin' that to them whippersnapper children ye see prowlin' about, I'd lose all me business if they knew thar' eatin' rightful vegetables!"" A great, booming voice from nearby suddenly yells, ""WHY DO MY POTATOES KEEP DISAPPEARING!"" Luginio then ducks his head, returning his attention to his now crackling frying pan. ""Hrm now lookie thar, I've nearly burned me fishin'! Well now, right nice day, be seein' ye!"" He whistles a little tune.

He is taking them to a locked chamber, hidden behind a grand tapestry, and performing actions of which I can only begin to know the nature of, and dare not utter aloud."" She breaks her speech and suddenly looks down and away, conquering a near display of discomposure. ""I think he is slow with his tortures, and this girl may still be alive and well, though I cannot set her free from her pending fate. The door is well built, and my skill for locks cannot defeat it. Should you use your mastered artifice and save this girl, I shall be indebted to you, though I entirely doubt the door can be opened by anything other than its key, found always upon the body of Lord Aderem."" Her face somber without expression, she stares at you awaiting reply.

4853,0,0,"The Sun in Winter
by Daymia Faranume

""He comes to me like seasons doth,
Withered, cold, renewed and warm,
The time we spent was n'er enough,
Though every solstice has a storm.

In frost I wanted sunlight's burn,
In heat I wanted chill,
In my fickleness I toss and turn,
While he's there standing still.""

Ƚ'7532"
4854,0,0,"""This brings us to one of the most misunderstood parts of a sword, the fuller. The fuller is a narrow groove running up the side of many swords.  It is very commonly believed to exist so that blood may drain through it, thus reducing suction and allowing a sword to be retrieved from a body with much less force. This belief is why the fuller is often referred to as the 'blood groove' or 'gutter'.  Despite these notions, the actual purpose of the fuller is to help reduce the weight of the blade, while still maintaining durability."" 

You close the book and set it back upon the shelf.

9019,0,0,"The ice blue eyes of Sheriff Lionheart gaze at you, as if he were peering

Ƚ'7532"
9020,0,0,"He smiles delightedly and clasps his hands together with fingers intertained.
""I have sought long and hard, using any tools I could to devise a means of

freedom. The only companionship I've had is from wandering adventurers like
yourself. Recently, I fell into a deep trance with the help of herbs and
magic, and let my spirit wander through the worlds. At first, it was just a
way to gain respite from my prison, and to continue to gain knowledge in the
arts. Instead of bringing me the comfort I had imagined, it only served to
make me more aware of my loneliness. I became obsessed and devoted my
searching for anything that could possibly help to provide a way out."" His
eyes glitter as he stares deeply into yours. ""I found it at last! Only, I can
not get there physically myself."" A look of frustration crosses his face.
""If you have strength in arts, and the desire to go, you might be able to

mental and physical. It's possible you may not survive..."" He looks at you,

Ƚ'7532"

Ƚ'7532"
9023,0,0,"Dhelvanen greets you with a relieved smile. ""I see I was right about you. You
have survived and brought me the stones. Now, at long last, I may know what
it is like to stand with the sun on my face again."" He immediately begins 
preparations for the task at hand. Walking all along the floor he places a
single diamond, eventually you see some sort of mythical pattern emerging
from the floor, and he then stands in the middle of it. He signals for you to be
silent as he begins a low hum that rumbles from deep in his chest. Eventually
it seems to become more prominent, and you feel an itching behind your ears.
The hum turns into a full rumble, and you almost wonder if the room is
shaking. His eyes light up with power and he raises his hands to the ceiling,
shouting long gutteral words and phrases. There is a flash, and you are almost
knocked to the ground by an unseen force. You open your eyes to see the mage,
looking more haggard then before. With saddened eyes he whispers ""Alas, I have

out on your reward!"" he says handing you a glowing sigil. ""Rest now and ease
your wounds, RETURN this to me when you are ready and I shall fulfill our
agreement."" He sits down then and begins to meditate.

Ƚ'7532"
9035,0,0,"item you can use. Type ""wear <weapon>"" so that weapon will be in your hand
ready to use.

Exit the weapons shop by heading south once. Then head west once. If you have
the ability to use spells you will want to go to the spell store. Check your
Mana by typing ""st"". Mana is roughly translated to be your life force energy.
This can be used to cast spells. This energy is depleted as you cast spells
but you can type ""rest"" and you will recover this energy so that you may cast
more spells. If you would like to buy some spells, head north one. Use the
same procedure in the spell store that you used in the armor shop to look
around and see what items you can get for free. Once you have purchased a
scroll with a spell on it you will want to ""read <scroll name>"" in order to
know how to cast that spell. Once you learn a spell you can cast it as often
as you wish as long as you have enough Mana. If you want to cast a spell type
""cast, spell name, target"" i.e. ""cast magic missile kobold""

The adventurers store is south of the magic store. If your character doesn't
have night vision, you will want to buy some torches here. You may type ""help
class"" to see whether or not you can see in the dark. To use a torch in a
dark area simply type ""use torch"".

Move west and type ""Look down"". This is the arena where you will go to fight
monsters when you are ready.

Right now, however, you should move north to the trainer. Type ""exp"" and you
will see that as a brand new character you have no experience. You gain
experience by fighting and killing monsters. When you have enough experience
you can move up a level by coming to the trainer and typing ""train"". Every
time that you move up a level you obtain additional lives( you start with
nine) if you need any, as well as more hit points which help you stay alive
longer in combat. Hit points are like your physical mana, the state of your
health and the physical strength that you have available. You lose hit points
Ƚ'7532"
9035,1,0,"in combat and regain them by typing ""rest"".

The only reason that you as a new character need to visit the trainer is if
you haven't already allocated all of your character points which you obtained
when you first generated your character. You may do this by typing ""train
stats"".

Move south and west to the healer. Type ""read sign"". If you would like to
buy a healing spell, type ""buy <spell name>"" i.e. ""buy minor healing"". These
spells will give you back your hit points faster than you could regenerate
them by resting. Always watch your hit points! If you get down to zero hit
points and you have no friends around to help you, you will die!

Now that you have had a brief tour of New Haven, you will want to start
fighting some monsters so that you can gain experience and start to move up
in level. Move back to the arena. You may also want to review the combat help
file by typing ""help combat"". Before you go down into the arena check to make
sure that you are wearing your armor (not just carrying it), have your weapon
in your hand ready to use, and that you know the spells that you may want to
cast. You may want to practice your magic, if you have Mana, by casting a
blur spell on yourself before you enter combat. This spell will make you
harder to hit. You will also want to try using the magic missile spell.

If you are a class or race with stealth, you'll want to practice sneaking by
typing SN, type it again if it tells you you don't think you are sneaking.
Once you think you are sneaking type D for down, and then type BS MONSTERNAME
(i.e. bs kobold). BS stands for backstab. If you don't successfully sneak or
backstab, you can always go back up and try again.

If you are a mystic, you have special attacks listed in the help combat
screen. JU MONSTERNAME (i.e. ju kobold) to jumpkick, or PU MONSTERNAME to
punch.

If you are not a class or race with stealth, and you are not a mystic or
magic user, you will type A MONSTERNAME (i.e. a kobold) to attack. You do Ƚ'7532"
9035,2,0,"need to type any adjectives in front of the name of the monster. For example,
if you are attacking an angry giant rat you only need to type A RAT.

Go down into the arena. A monster will appear for you to fight. Don't wait
for the monster to attack you! Go get 'em! Watch your hit points. If you find
that you are getting close to zero type ""up"" to get out of the arena. Don't
worry if you get killed the first time. You have eight more lives and can
always create a new character if you want to. Once you have killed a monster,
you should check your hit points to see how many you have lost. If you have
only a few hit points left you might get killed by the next monster which
appears, so you will want to go up out of the arena and rest until you regain
your strength. If you should be killed by a monster you will start again at
the healer with nothing, and you will need to go back to the various shops to
get more armor, weapons etc. You will retain knowledge of any spells that you
know before you were killed.

Occasionally monsters will drop money when they are killed. This money is
yours if you can get it without getting killed by the next monster that
appears. Simply type ""get"" followed by the quantity and type of coin, i.e.
""get 8 silver"". This money will come in handy when you want to buy better
weapons or spells.

Remember to check your experience and go to the trainer when you have enough
points to go up a level.

When you have reached level 3, you are ready to move on to Silvermere. Head
southwest and follow that trail until you reach the boatman. Type BORROW
SKIFF to row across the water to the new city. Once you have reached the far
dock, type MAP. This will show you a map of the city you are now in and where
everything is at. Move south to get to River Street. Explore around and start
finding new monsters to fight, like in the slums to the south. Join groups of
larger characters to get to places you normally couldn't and to go on quests.
Ƚ'7532"
9035,3,0,"Most importantly, have a good time!
Ƚ'7532"

guards. The plain key is for the front door. A tax of 150 gold is assessed each 
night for the house. At the entrance you may create a key to the door, and in any room you may summon additional guards for a price, or make an emblem for free. You can also purchase a healer in your ""resting room"" for a price.

9114,0,0,"You thumb through the diary. At the beginning, the entries seem normal   
enough--the gravedigger's simple but firm handwriting cataloguing burials,
and noting the occasional full moon and such...

[0;1;32m...But something catches your eye as you skim through the pages...[0;32m
""Silvermere Council has ordered excavation past the Marble Tomb. History
has said this place is to never be disturbed, but how little our own city
remembers this. I fear what it may bring.""  

[0;1;32m...A few pages later...[0;32m
""Excavation is finished, and the undead have grown more restless. My charm
of protection seems to affect them less and less. Just last night, after 
burying some poor sod, a zombie approached me and almost took a swing at 
me, and then moved on. I don't know if I'm being paranoid or not, but I 
feel more ill is going to come of this."" 

[0;1;32m...Another page reads...[0;32m
""Today I had to beat off two zombies and a skeleton before finding solace 
in my shack. Must remember to go to the bishop or Sheriff and ask for 
aid.""

[0;1;32m...As you get close to the end of the diary, another page catches your 
eye...[0;32m
""Heavens forgive me... I know not what I have done. Last night, as I
was burying what was left of a dwarf who had met up with too many dire
wolves, a black-cloaked figure suddenly appeared out of thin air. He
smelled worse than any coffin I've ever had to dig up, and though I could
not see his face, I could somehow sense evil, and I felt a chill crawl   
over my body. The figure did not speak, and yet I heard a voice echoing
in my head... a voice that terrified me to my very bones... 'It will only
get worse before it gets better, mortal. A dark plague is coming to
consume this land. This has been foretold, but it appears that the
victorious seem to forget old debts. I offer you the chance to join the
side that is destined for victory, or I can end your living misery and
ensure that your bones never find rest.' Frozen with fear, I coulȽ'7532"
9114,1,0,"nod my head numbly. 'Wise choice, mortal,' the dreadful voice growled.
'Take this, as a token of your allegiance to me. It will cause the undead 
to ignore you, and only you. Remember me. I'm not through with you yet.' 
Then the figure vanished, leaving behind a black shovel covered in 
horrible runes. Though I tried to resist, the shovel seemed to find its 
way to my hand, and I felt my stomach twinge when I touched it. I did not 
dream well last night......""

[0;1;32m...Every page after this entry is barely legible...  You can only make out
a few words here and there... 
""help me... PROPHECY... mother... HE COMES... right... been a cobbler... 
DEATH SHALL COME AGAIN...""

Kulgar to bring the barricade down.  However, those days are gone and past, and
I am paying for my [0;1;32mmistake[0;32m every minute.""  Those last bitter words bring
a tear to his eye.  It's obvious he misses the past.

Ƚ'7532"
9240,0,0,"Kotar composes himself and pulls his cloak around him tighter, ""Yes, soon after

Ƚ'7532"
9241,0,0,"""As you can see, I am a dark-elf.  Before I left the Queens castle, I was fourth

Ƚ'7532"

Ƚ'7532"
9349,0,0,"With a twisted chuckle the hermit gives you a yellow-toothed grin. He collects
his thoughts before speaking. ""Indeed this library was once known as the
greatest gathering of knowledge in all the lands. Unfortunately it too was touched with politics, being run by worthless fools that did not know the true meaning of knowledge."" His demeanor darkens immensely as he continues ""One such imbecile was the last head librarian, he did not take kindly to one who would meddle in uncharted arts!"" Suddenly he seems to grow ten feet tall and begins to speak in high pitched tones, his shrill words making your head ache. ""He did not know what power lay when working in darker arts, he was too afraid of the true meaning it could bring, oh he's getting his dues now though, that pitiful fool!"" Before his ranting continues he realizes his place and returns to the humble, old, hermit. ""Or at least that is what I've been told."" He says with another yellow-toothed grin.

9411,0,0,"""...the Great War. Most of the cities were razed to the ground by Hellfire, their citizens slaughtered or driven into the surrounding countryside, forced to live in fearful squalor while the armies of the Dark One continued their destruction. The places the least affected by the War were the isolated cities-- Daerlon, Silvermere, Goldhome, and the like, as the Dark One concentrated his attacks upon the centers of strength from the outset, and even by the time the dark forces were finally repelled, they had not yet reached them. The forests of the Elves escaped wrath, of course, as their obscuring magics prevented the enemy from penetrating far into the wood. The Dwarves had but to shut their impenetrable iron doors and let the tides of Orcs pound themselves senseless against them. The Kang simply stayed in their swamps, as any evil force who entered had not only to battle the hostile swamp, but the
clever guerilla tactics of the Kang warriors. The other races,
however, suffered greatly, their numbers decimated by the
ruthless and ceaseless assaults of the dark tide...""

With that he slapped the ass of the horse so that it would ride off with great haste. And so it did, and for awhile peace returned once more to Arlysia...""

Ƚ'7532"
9418,0,0,"It is said that the Great War did not start with a klaxon alarm or the blare of trumpets but with the groans and whimpers of a merchant dying on the Forest Road. Travelers from Khazarad to Silvermere were sometimes accosted by bandits on the Swampside Path but for the most part the Dwarven Guardsmen and Gnomish patrols kept the path safe. Above the Cliff however the story was much different. Traveling parties and even militia from Silvermere were being ambushed by hidden archers and groups of well armed thieves and 
rogues. The Kings Governor in the new city of Silvermere, one Humpfrey Lionheart by name, was well aware that this increased banditry threatened a major link between the newly formed Council of the Five Kingdoms and had sent daily couriers to Port Blackwater by way of the newly completed Western Road. Humpfrey was astounded to hear by way of a ""Kings Runner"" that the High King himself was coming to Silvermere. What the good Governor would soon learn was that the King was coming in force with his entire entourage and that the Kings 
Scriers had foreseen a great doom looming near Silvermere.

Ƚ'7532"
9419,0,0,"The arrival of the King in Silvermere was a cause for much celebration. Fires burned in the Town Square for several nights and long guarded supplies were brought out for great feasting. In the High Kings party was the son of the Governor, Godfrey, a sworn Holy Knight of the household guard, and a daughter of Kulgar, Ca'trine, sworn Holy Knight and treaty foster daughter to the King. 
Ca""trine chose to go in public by the name Doggie Doober, a childish corruption in the common tongue of the Dwarven phrase for ""eager worker"". The army accompanying the King, one thousand souls, but a small part of his forces, was a wonder in it's time. Mixed Races, mixed Classes, squads of stealthy 
scouts and companies of Half-Ogre Warriors, troops of Mages to bring down fire and troops of Priests to call down the wrath of the Gods. Healers, Singers, thinkers and seers, a thing put together never seen in the Realm before. The Kings entourage including his lovely Queen Brendan, his son and her two
daughters, as well as many servants and councilors were housed in the Government House overlooking the City Park. The King made his Headquarters above the Guild Hall and the army was quartered in the Park 
and in the Barracks of the City Towers.

Ƚ'7532"
9420,0,0,"Since the heavy combat along the Forest Road had made a severe mark on Trade it was some time before the people of Silvermere realized that slim trade had turned into none, Kulgar had Barricaded the road to protect his own Kingdom and the Council of the Five Kingdoms was broken. The first foray of the forces of Albion was the dispatch through the hidden sally port in the sewers of a party of the most stealthy of the kings scouts, followed closely by a company of heavy infantry through the city gate. The scouts reported that the organized Thieves and Rogues withdrew to the north in the face of a deliberately noisy force. The King dispatched a company of light infantry along with magical support troops to reinforce the Half-Ogre force and the assembly followed a well worn path north from the road from a place near the peculiar Blue Tower of the merchant Jorah. Beating off nuisance attacks by goblin archers the force found it's way to a Huge Cave, the apparent source of the organized banditry. Hoisting torches and lanterns the Light Infantry led the way and swept aside  a determined but doomed guard of Goblins and fought deep into the barracks of Ogre Guards and Warriors where they took some unpleasantly severe losses.  Due to the narrow passages the brave Half-Orcs were unable to support each other and the heavier forces and magical support were unable to come quickly forward. Once the force was able to properly array itself they swept forward and cleared all the Cave of hostile forces. Or so they thought, for the Huge Cave has many hidden places.

Ƚ'7532"
9421,0,0,"Even before the Kings forces could recover their dead or their weapons word came that Gnolls were attacking the southern suburbs of Silvermere from the Dragons Teeth Hills and they were recalled with all haste to the City. Footsore and tired the force charged the entire route, through the Cave and the Forest, up the Forest Road and right through Silvermere without a pause. With the lightly armored Mystics, Rangers, Ninjas and Druids trotting in the lead they charged through the Western Door into the heart of the besieging Gnoll 
army. The Gnolls were thrown into disarray but the Kings forces once again suffered heavy losses in the most lightly armored of the troops. Kreegaks Gnolls, acting on orders of Lord Cambron mounted a quick counterattack but it was beaten off with only small losses amongst the Kings troops and the City Militia was able to close the Western Door and mount a solid defense over the now ruined workers quarters in the suburb.

Ƚ'7532"
9422,0,0,"The City was secure but with both the Forest Road and the Western Road closed, reinforcement was unlikely. After weeks of stalemate punctuated by increasingly savage assaults out of the Darkwood against the Gate and Eastern walls and accentuated by the silent siege of the Western Door pickets on the Dock defenses and guards on the Graveyard Bridge reported a large number of boats passing upstream singing the songs of Kagh-eh-Goru. They did not approach Silvermere but passed upstream and out of sight. None of the Militia or the Kings advisors knew what this might mean for as yet the forces of Goru-Nezar had not been identified as hostile, but as word filtered out some others took note. The King could not know that this was not the first move of Goru-Nezar but the second. The first move had been an assault on the Elven town in the Northern Forests. Using information supplied by his ally the Quickling Lord the forces of Goru-Nezar bypassed the Hill of Seeing and fell upon the Tower of Study, crushing it utterly. Unable to find the entry to the town hidden by
Elven magic the army eventually fell victim to the forces of the forest, at the end even the trees themselves joined the fight doing savage damage to the Ogre army. The curses of Goru-Nezar blighted parts of the Old Forest but could not save his tattered force. It was however an acceptable price to pay to keep the Elves out of the battle to come. Goru's hope rode with the success of the second force. It's purpose was to extinguish all hope of goodness and light in the world and as it progressed the clouds gathered and the sun could not
be seen.

Ƚ'7532"
9423,0,0,"Unknown to the King there existed near this newest outpost of his realm a most potent force for good. Secreted above the Eastern Waterfall was the Temple of the Order of the Phoenix. In fact the region around Silvermere held many surprises for the King. Without warning the Gnoll siege from the Dragons Teeth Hills was broken from behind. A Sergeant Markus of the Royal Guards arrived escorted by a fierce band of fighters led by the Mage Morukai Soulscourge from the independent town of Rhudaur. Markus told the High King that word of the 
situation was already on the way to the Capitol in the hands of the one eyed Ranger Skarlock Rasthall and two Guardsmen from his post in the Black Mountains. Morukai requested a closed audience with the King and
emerged within the hour wearing the Kings Colors on his arm and the knot of Captain on his shoulder, his men also donned the Kings Colors and assembled themselves in a privately owned warehouse near the Docks. Less than a day later the siege of the Gate was broken by an even larger party emerging from the Mountains north of the Darkwood and led by the Bard Orfeo Talespinner. Orfeo also attended the King and emerged as a captain in the Kings Colors, He and his men joined the forces of Morukai near the Docks.

Ƚ'7532"
9424,0,0,"These developments caused much concern and whispering among the people of Silvermere and the men of the Kings army particularly when Godfrey Lionheart and a picked band of Paladins moved to the same warehouse under the Kings Orders. Within days the Ranger Skarlock led the lead elements of a relief column up the Western Road and the mood in Silvermere brightened perceptibly. In a few more days the Kings Army had grown to over four thousand souls. With all of this activity it comes as no surprise that the absence of Morukai, Orfeo and Godfrey went unnoticed for some time. Above the eastern Waterfall the forces of the Red Mage Goru-Nezar had smashed the surface fortifications of the Temple of the Phoenix and with brute force were digging into the many levels of the Catacombs beneath, driving the Templar Dorshar Lightblade and the Order of 
the Phoenix deeper and deeper into their final refuge. The losses taken by the Templars were terrible but each of them was bought dearly and the army of Goru-Nezar made it's progress at great cost. At the end, Dorshar and his fellow Templars stood defending the last passages outside the Grotto of the Phoenix 
when Morukai and Orfeo, using exotic mining tools of Gnomish invention, fell upon the forces of the Red Mage from behind, driving them to a frenzy and smashing them utterly. The last of them, Goru-Nezars own Necromancer died within reach of the Phoenix Egg, struck down By Dorshar Himself.

Ƚ'7532"
9425,0,0,"At that moment the clouds above the Realm parted allowing the sun to shine brightly through, raising the spirits of the Kings forces and announcing the fell news to Goru-Nezar faster than any messenger could fly. Tired and wounded, Dorshar knew his time as guardian of the Phoenix was past and seeing Godfrey in the party of his salvation recognized a younger kindred spirit. He passed his knowledge and authority to Godfrey and the few survivors of the Order of the Phoenix joined Godfreys Paladins in the new Order of Light. The fortifications of the Temple were beyond repair but by the employment of Gnomish specialists and tools the Catacombs were turned into an impassible maze and the old stone stairway beside the waterfall was cut away leaving no trace of where it had been. The secret of the only way to reach the Temple was now safely out
concealed in Kulgars Kingdom, far from the reach of the Red Mage.

Ƚ'7532"
9426,0,0,"Driven to mad desperation Goru-Nezar envisioned a final solution to isolate the Phoenix of Light in it's Temple by destroying Silvermere. He sent part of his force across the river to the Dragons Teeth Hills to attack Silvermere from the west while his main force marched down the Old Road to the Silver River to attack the Silvermere Docks. The forces of the Red Mage clashed briefly with Kreegaks Gnolls over the leadership of this assault but this was quickly put aside and the combined force advanced on the Western Road. Unfortunately the Kings scouts had heard the clash of arms reverberating through the hills and by the time the Gnolls and the forces of Goru-Nezar reached the Road the army of the King was waiting and the attack was smashed almost to the last man. A few survivors fled back to the hidden Gnoll camp but would never be in a
position to threaten the Realm again.

Ƚ'7532"
9427,0,0,"The main force of Goru-Nezar was observed by Orfeo and Morukai as they were returning to Silvermere on the river and their advantage of surprise was lost. Practitioners of the Magic arts loyal to the King whipped the river to a froth beating back the massed attack to the Silvery Pool where the entire might of the King was launched against them. The next few days were terrible in the Ironwood, two great forces matched each other in the largest contest of arms ever seen in the Realm. Backward and forward the two great armies surged,
ravaging the once beautiful Old Road but step by step the forces of the King prevailed driving the Red Mage back. At the end Goru-Nezar fell back into his city behind his well maintained walls and fortifications. The Kings army stood upon the ruins of the Ogre Camp in front of the city gates. The Red Mage would ask for no quarter and it is unlikely that the King would grant any so the siege was mounted and went on for weeks. Great engines battered at the walls and the forces of magic were employed by both sides, the carnage was
terrible. Then, when Goru-Nezar was concentrating his energies upon the King, with a single great crash it was over. With the turning of a card in a monastery far away Annora called down the power of the Gods, Goru-Nezar and his army destroyed, his city crushed.

Ƚ'7532"
9428,0,0,"Looking on in wonder the King could only pray his thanks to an unknown ally, succor his wounded and gather his honored dead. The smoldering ruins were too dangerous to enter so the King posted a guard of elven scouts and
gathered his battered army for the return to Silvermere. On the slow and painful march back down the Ravaged Path the King was met by a messenger bringing news of yet another foul blow in Silvermere. A raiding party
had struck secretly within the walls. The Queen lay in the Temple severely wounded, the Government house was sacked, much of the Household Guard was dead and the Kings Children stolen away. 

Ƚ'7532"
9429,0,0,"The King rushed on ahead of his army with only a small guard and at the Silvery Pool was met by another messenger. The Ranger Skarlock had led the troops of Orfeo and Morukai as well as Doggie Doober and the survivors of the Household Guard into the southern suburb and into caverns they had discovered beneath the
house of a recently founded Cult. No word had come back from them for several days and no traces of them had been found by the few brave Militiamen who had returned from the search. The Kings return to Silvermere was a gloomy one. The city was in good condition , the defenses were once again strongly manned but few smiles were to be seen on the streets. Scouts reported no hostile activity East or West, North or South, but the pall of dread that hung over the City was paralyzing.

After about a week Silvermere was rocked by a slight tremor in the earth and smoke was seen to rise from Cult House tinting it black. None of the Kings scriers could tell what it meant other than that there were great
forces involved.

Ƚ'7532"
9430,0,0,"Deep under the ground Skarlock led the hunters, through a strange Fungus Forest they pursued the raiders and into a Black Chasm they followed them. In a Village of Serpentkin they fell upon the raiders slaying many,
but with the help of the lizard folk the surviving raiders carried their captives away into a maze of strange Crystalline Passages. The hunters followed and in a strange twist of fortune emerged at a Dreary Village
ahead of their prey. Waiting in ambush Skarlock, Morukai, Orfeo and Doggie fell upon the raiders, killing them to a man and freed the children. Doggie ordered the Household Guard to return to Silvermere with the Prince and Princesses while she went with the others to discover the source of this outrage.

Ƚ'7532"
9431,0,0,"Skarlock led the way through the Dreary Village and onto the road through the Kher Grass fields before a massive Black Fortress. It was clear that a party this size could not force the gate. Then Skarlock did a remarkable thing, removing the eyepatch from above his scarred left cheek he revealed a glittering crystal orb set into his ruined eye socket. He stood studying the Black Fortress with this magic eye for several minutes then returned the eyepatch and led the party south into the seemingly impassible fields and to a path that led to a secret side door to the Fortress. By stealth, guile and a certain charm they defeated the defenders in these shadowy passages and slew the triumvirate of Dark Lords, each in their own offices.

Ƚ'7532"
9432,0,0,"In a concealed Dark Temple they found the force behind all the mischief that had bedeviled Silvermere, Lord Cambron, The Champion of Blood. Rallying all their resources the party fell upon Cambron and in a fierce battle defeated him only to discover that he was but a husk occupied by the Hellion, perhaps the Blood God himself. Fighting now in quiet desperation the party used all of their skills and talents but many of their followers perished in the horrid blasts of the combat. In the end it was the good Doggie Doober that struck 
the mortal blow, the Hellion vanished in a blast of energy that was the source of the tremors felt in Silvermere. When the Household Guard emerged with the children there was much rejoicing in Silvermere and when Skarlock, Morukai, Orfeo and Doggie returned with their surviving troops they were feted and feasted around the town. In thanks, the King proclaimed Silvermere a free town, exempt from royal taxes and free to elect their own leadership to replace the aging Humpfrey. He asked only for the loyalty of the city in return for his 
own loyalty. ""After all"" he said, ""Silvermere needs no King to defend it when it has citizens such as these."" The King returned to his Capitol across the Sea taking with him Dorshar, Doggie and the Governor Humpfrey but
many of his troops retired in Silvermere, doing much to improve the quality of the Militia and it's training. Markus returned to the Black Mountains with a captains knot on his shoulder. After a time the City became once again a backwater where nothing of much importance ever happened and eventually the Western Road fell into disrepair and was blocked by rockfall and avalanche cutting the City off from the rest of the Kingdom. The Barricade on the Forest Road would be removed opening the way once again to the East. But Silvermere would always be known as a place where great things HAD happened and the legends live on.......

9436,0,0,"""Draka's Death
Many years ago there was a great and mighty witchunter, of the cat-race. He became the biggest and brightest Crimson Flame to shine in many ages. Fearless was he in the slaying of the great and many demon-sent magi that roamed the earth, as well as fending off soulless demons that threatened our realm, as they first did on that black day in Jurard. This is the sad tale of his last days. Many times he was found to travel in the valley of Arlysia, known for the famous library which kept any book it found to be sacred and treasured. Peace was well known through the valley, and what monsters he found were vanquished by his quick use of the blade, which was forged for him by the finest smiths
of the Order. One day a great and malevolent kai demon using the name Enigma Lord fell upon the valley with great and sudden ferocity, using his black arts he scorched many farms and slain any who would lie in his wake. Refuges of his wrath by the hundreds fled into the town many counts of the deadly force with which the motherless mystic did use to kill any who he saw. Brandishing his great blade Draka begin his hunt for the fiend, going to all corners of the valley until he found him deep in the heart of the Blackwood Forest. The kai one quaked and shook from the raw and righteous fury which had consumed Draka.
""Bow now for your purification!"" Draka did say. Black was the cackle that left the lips of the Enigma and he spit upon the feet of Draka. Vengeful and furious did Draka become and he struck at the Engima Lord, his blade shining in the afternoon sun. Fearful was the mystic, for he could see his death in the blade of the inquisitor, even so he dodged many of the swings from Draka, and counter attacked with swift punches, and kicks. The battle waged all through the forest, the mystic fleeing like Ƚ'7532"
9436,1,0,"a sick dog, and Draka upon him like a kingly lion. Finally he was cornered on the western shore of the Arlysian Lake, and Draka did strike the blow that felled the wicked lord. So mighty was the blow that the lord was thrown into the lake, turning it crimson with his last drops of blood. Draka, himself heavily wounded did return to the township, where he was greeted by great any many cheers. Delirious from the pain he did accept the kindness of a shawled old woman, who gave him water. Drank it did he, and only realizing as the last drop hit his tongue that it was poison which he consumed. Gazed did Draka at the Engima Lord who was the cowled old woman, using darkest treachery to have his revenge upon the inquisitor. With the last strength of his hand, Draka swung his mighty blade, cleaving the head of the Enigma, before
himself dying from the poison which he had unknowingly drank.

9437,0,0,"""Within these pages, friend you will find a compilation of the Prophecy of Plague, as originally recorded by sages from long ago, take great heed that this should never come to pass, for it could mean many and great dire things. 
The prophecy is not a plague in the physical sense, but of the spiritual sense. 
Only the most soulless or hellbent would ever consider undertaking, but history has proven some individuals as that do walk this realm and desire the power held within. The prophecy is gotten by a process evil and filled with dark ceremonies. Essentially it is the process of turning one into a being of undeath, but with greater power, and a constant thirst for the souls of others. What is required is a jewel of great size and value, this is most essential for it shall hold the life force of the being. Next is a chain of great worth, which shall link the soul of that being to the jewel which shall contain it. Next is the heart of a magical and evil beast, with many atrocities committed 
by it, for it is the power of this beast which is used in the transformation to undead. The greater the evil, the more power brought by the transformation. Take these items into a black and lightless cavern of stone, and construct a great portal made from the bones of innocent men slain by their own tools. So great is the power of this creature that it can consume the souls of many with a wave of its hand, with blackest necromancy it can destroy all the living in the realm, making undead subjects of any who oppose it.  The Plague must never happen, and should you be a tool towards that end, reader, I curse you to the farthest ends of Hell.

9440,0,0,"""...It was only after the pharaoh had exhausted the quarry's supply of
sandstone did he make the decision to delve further into the mountainside.
Long did the slaves labour under the burning sun to carve out more stone
blocks for the pharaoh's pyramid, and many perished under the cruel whips of
the overseers. Winding tunnels had pierced the quarry walls, delving deep
into the rock, when they came upon the ore.

Blood-red it was, and harder than steel. When the overseers first reported
the metal to the pharaoh, he immediately was overcome with lustful images of
his armies wielding strong new weapons. He doubled the number of slaves, and
set them to mining this new ore. So great was his want for the strange metal,
that thousands died and were dragged outside for the carrion-birds to devour.
Tensions rose as even the strongest slaves began to weaken from malnutrition
and abuse. Finally, one day, as the pharaoh was personally overseeing the
mining operation, an angry slave picked up a jagged chunk of the red iron ore
and flung it at the pharaoh.

What happened next was a shock to everyone. All knew that the pharaoh was a
mighty wizard, and many had perished while attempting to slay him. Normal
weaponry simply would not harm him, as he was cloaked in a magical barrier.
However, when the chunk of red ore struck the pharaoh in the head, he reeled
backward, blood dripping from a deep cut. For what seemed like an eternity,
all froze in shock and horror. Then, suddenly, incredulous that he had been
harmed by a mere slave, the pharaoh unleashed a storm of flame upon the slave
that incinerated him on the spot. Their daze broken by the magical destruction of their comrade, the other slaves immediately began stoning the pharaoh with shards of the red ore.

In a bloody fury, the pharaoh called upon his immense magical powers. Demonic
magic swirled about the chamber, causing all who viewed it to stop what they
Ƚ'7532"
9440,1,0,"were doing and quiver in terror. With a triumphant, bloodthirsty cry, the
pharaoh completed his spell, and vanished.

For a moment all thought he had simply left. Abruptly, however, a rumbling
far beneath the earth rocked everyone off of their feet. The rock at the far
end of the chamber split open with great violence, revealing a hideous dark
abomination! The pharaoh, in his indignant hatred, had summoned a nether
beast to devour all who remained in the mine.

It is at this point that I turned and ran for my life. The sound of horrified
slaves and overseers being devoured will haunt me for the rest of my life.
Once a cruel overseer, I now am a simple monk who lives in penitence for my
former crimes. Perhaps I was the only one who survived to tell this tale.
May God have mercy on their souls.""

9533,0,0,"The Great Ones
The great race of the Orcs started long ago, in a time before times, when the 
darkness had yet to be challenged by the light. Already had the footsteps of 
the Sylva and the Khaz been laid upon the soft earth, but a strange set of new 
races had risen, one promising race among them stood and called itself Human. 
It is not known however by any mortal on this plane where these wanderers came 
from, but their talents to adapt to change seemed endless, and for this reason 
they were frowned upon by the stalwart Sylva and the rugged Khaz. As time past 
the races seemed to forge an uncomfortable peace, but one dark day a strange 
orb struck the small town of Cenlus and from the ashes walked the single 
demonic visage of the first Orc. He was tall, maybe six feet, but seemed to be 
built to be everything that the Sylva was not. The balance had begun. The light 
that banished the darkness of innocence had been challenged by the first true 
evil. More and more of this powerful race appeared over time, though from what 
I can tell no women had been seen. For a while I forget this great race, but 
when in the tower of Jurard writing a speech for the namesake king of that 
great country a strange man entered. He was cloaked in a great green and 
black cloak, and he obviously wore layers of animal skins beneath it, as I 
could see from the part in his cloak. His face was shrouded save those 
burning eyes, those same eyes I saw when scrying, so long ago, rising 
from the ashes of Cenlus. I know not what he said that day as his language 
was strange to me, but I quickly wrote it down with his supervision:
""Dark was that day, formed from the ashes of myself, I became dark. The 
mage, my father showed me his dark secret. I could not contain his great 
power, it caught me off guard and it split my infernal body into the dark 
and the light, the sparkle and the sword. I know not why I was saved, but 
Ƚ'7532"
9533,1,0,"rage stole my body and I ripped my other half to pieces before my master's 
eyes. My sin will never be forgiven, he cursed me to know with the spark of 
the light what I had done, and in rage I tried to join my other half in the 
blood. My master would not let me, cursed to live forever in darkness with 
the spark to know what I am! The orb of magic that split me destroyed a 
small town, transformed it to what you now call wasteland, beyond the south. 
My body twisted, leaving me torn, the light of Sylva gone the dark of Orc now. 
I have no need to hurt any longer but in defense, I saw your scry upon me it'
s eye burning me, today I have found you."" 
Afterwards he looked at me with a saddened face and threw back his hood, and I 
beheld an angel before me, this beast which spawned the Horde had become a 
golden child. He stood erect and placed his hand over my eyes and my body raged 
with power, when I awakened I could not see. I write this now with the aid of 
my son Morukai, I am told he was born with gifts not known to any before him, 
the Great One, the Orc still aids me now through my son, I only hope he can 
save us from what the scry has told.
As you finish reading the passage there is a small elegant note at the bottom 
written in blue ink:
My father was an excellent teacher to me as a scribe, and my awakened power is 
due to his inquisition I have no doubt, however he never was given the chance 
to translate the speech of the Orc, I have done what I can to. A and E seem 
to be spoken and written as Ai. C is replaced by Cs, K by a Ch, O by a U, 
U by a Uo, W by a Ou, S by C, and it seems an H is added after many letter, 
however I have more pressing matters to worry of this, I have seen his mind and 
know it well.
