Ƚ'7532"
9686,0,0,"Long ago in a forgotten land, there was a Dwarf Paladin, who aspired to
become godlike. Were he pious enough he would realized his foolishness,
but he was stubborn, and blind to the ways of divinity.

His journey began in the town of Silvermere where he was befriended by a
Dark-elven Bard, and a Dwarf Paladin like himself, who believed he had
the power of a god already, but that is another story.

Joined into the House of Lords did our hero do, and on many adventures 
did he go. On a particular adventure the House determined to ransack the 
dark cave of the goblins, drawing straws it was determined that our hero 
would be the pack mule, and so he has forced to bear the weight of hordes 
of copper and silver thereafter. So great was the weight upon his 
shoulders be likened himself to a mighty bull, carrying anything upon his 
broad shoulders. However the strain was so much that it weighed upon his 
brain as well.

On one such excursion he was struck with delirium, and soon began to Moo 
to all he saw, and went into a berserking rage, slaying all the goblins 
they encountered, who were in fits of confusion by this Mooing madman.

So enraged was he that a nearby torch set fire to him, and he did not
notice it, so insane had he become. Through some form of luck he and his
companions made it out alive, carrying out easily two thousand gold a 
piece from their raid.

As they shared drinks at the Homely Hearth his friends determined from 
that point onward he would be known as the Flaming Cow God of DOOM. For 
he carried a bull's share, had lived through flame, and brought doom 
upon all he saw.

This pleased him for he believed this proved he was destined for divinity,
he would find out how mortal he was, but that is another story....

Ƚ'7532"
9687,0,0,"The Summarized Theories of Dark Distortion - 
By the Great Zanthusonius
Though many before have futile tried to write the theory thus far of the Dark Distortion, I Zanthusonius shall take it upon myself to write the collection with a more knowledgeable and delicate hand. And so I begin reader take heed, no
one can be more brilliant in their writings then me.

The Dark Distortion is more or less derived from another theory concerning the universe existing in several instances. Each instance being of it's own independent system then those others that exist with it. Many speculations indicate that one could possibly even go between instances, seeing each one
with each course changed. Other speculations indicate that planar existences
can also be used to traverse these great voids between instances of different
multiversal situations. With that said the Dark Distortion was developed with by the thinking of the most enlightened Helvectus, who determined that in these various instances that for each single reality there is a distorted one, purely
corrupted by the powers of supreme evil. Further he has scribed in his previous
writings that those dark distortions ultimately connect with that instance of
reality for which it is distorted by, and if that connection were brought about
by focused energy through a single body, he would reap rewards from both worlds.
Rumour spreads that this Helvectus attempted many times to create such connections between twisted and untwisted worlds, how ever since his abrupt
Ƚ'7532"
9687,1,0,"vanishing 100 years ago no one else has attempted duplication of this theory, or no one that has survived at least. Moving forward, the basics are that most things evil in the uncorrupted instance are even more so in the distorted one, while things that may be of pure or balanced mind have some taint on them, significant or no, nothing is virginal in this dark reality. Many writings indicate that religious writings that describe end time cataclysm's actually refer to this event of merging where the pure and vile become as one, obliterating both in the process. With the many elements of planar travel that occur this is most likely not due to occur, simply because of low risk odds 
that enough power could be gathered as a source to manifest such a polyversal event. I shall continue with this in other writings as my research of Helvectus continues on ward.
-Z

Ƚ'7532"
9688,0,0,"""Ages ago, a time of great peace filled the realm. This was the Age of
Prosperity and existed because a true balance between good and evil had
been reached. The few skirmishes that occurred were trivial, personal matters
and the consensus of citizens of the realm was that they felt safer than they
ever had before.

""Silvermere was experiencing success and growth greater than any other
period in its history while alliances among all races were forged. It surely was
an age of prosperity for all. Unfortunately, this could not last; prophecies,
long since forgotten, predicted that the power balance would change, and change
it did. 

""Rhudar was a bustling town full of economic wealth during the Age of
Prosperity and its population was rapidly growing to rival Silvermere's.
Its temple, perceived by the realm to be honoring the codes and treaties
of the time, taught the ancient rituals of magick to any willing and devout
adventurer who applied. This alone helped increased the popularity of the
city. Unbeknownst to all, a calculated and growing evil was festering
within. The Grandmaster of the Shadow Fist Temple had grown more than
weary of his limited powers.""

""Whether the matter is understandable as mere lust for power, or the
Grandmaster truly failed to appreciate that balance leads to prosperity,
is academic. Thus began the end of the Age of Prosperity and the
transformation of the Shadow Fist Temple to an evil brotherhood possessed by greed, lust for power and ultimate domination of the realm.

""Working with a malefic diligence, the Grandmaster ordered the brotherhood
to cull ancient documents and knowledge of dark magick from the realm. No one
suspected his motives and no request for long-forgotten scrolls was
denied. It is the nature of evil to take simple agreement for weakness and it made the Grandmaster impudently proud of the mass of information gathered by

""While the haughty Grandmaster assumed his actions went ignored, one man
in the realm felt the tipping of the balance scale. Dorshar Lightblade, a
human and a witchhunter by profession, may have been the most balanced soul to
have ever existed in the realm. It was the Phoenix, Bel-Lai, the embodiment of
divine equilibrium, which selected Dorshar, and which instructed and
charged him to devote his life and energies to a golden mean of balance. Neither
side in the struggle for good and evil should gain too much power.
Domination by one side or the other would lead to destruction of the realm. Neither good nor evil could exist truly without the other.

""Dorshar worked quietly, remaining a passive observer, mindful that his
own interfering within the realm might be as disruptive of balance as any
overt attempt of good or evil. When he discovered the scheme of the Grandmaster
and informed the Phoenix, immediate action was necessary.

""Battles raged for years, yet the Grandmaster's strength increased.
Dorshar, aligned with the unprepared followers of good, valiantly resisted. Then, at the darkest moment, the Dark One's Avatar moved to gain control of the 
Phoenix herself, to obtain ultimate power for the Grandmaster. Dorshar led 
the Templars of the Golden Light, a holy order sworn to protect the
Phoenix, against the seemingly unstoppable Avatar. Tragically, it appeared to all that the Grandmaster would succeed in his corrupted plans.""

""Bel-Lai had not though, existed for eons without learning a trick or two
herself. The Phoenix determined that avoiding the destruction of the
realm, even at the cost of her own liberty warranted sacrifice. She entreated
Morukai, a mage of legendary renown, to imprison her in a manner to keep
her from the clutches of the Grandmaster. Although this was accomplished
successfully and the Grandmaster was stopped in his quest for ultimate
Ƚ'7532"
9688,2,0,"domination and power, the Age of Prosperity was now only a memory. To this

threats to it constantly. Only the actions of new adventurers will

9690,0,0,"I must write this with great haste for even now they come for me.
I am but the simple innkeeper of the Dancing Dragon outside Arlysia, a crazed man garbed in gypsy leathers stumbled upon my doorstep not too long ago, this night was already considered a bad omen due to the great storm that came already upon this night. He babbled constantly, speaking of his fear of 
an evil hag who was coming for him, begging and pleading to provide him shelter.
We were not so far from the Arlysia gates so I was tempted to send him there but something in me decided against it. I wish I had not. 
Shortly a large gathering of gypsy dogs appeared, one indeed lead by an old woman, with a dark gleam in her eye. They all wielded wicked weapons of torture, each one looking more menacing then the next. They  stood outside and I came out to meet them, the elderly demanded I turn over the babbler to them, that there work was not finished. Mustering what courage I could I denied them, telling them whatever wretched deeds they wished I would not be party to. She warned me that he was a banished one from their tribe, and I would regret my decision. Again I declined, and like a breeze of wind they all vanished. 
With the help of my serving wenches and various patrons we all did what we could to soothe the babbler, nothing seemed to work and we gave him an upstairs room to die in. As the morning sun came up, so did he, brighter spirits then before. He gave no thanks and merely said he would return eventually and give me something proper for one such as me. Had I known how sinister those words were I would have gutted him there. He too vanished and was forgotten.
Ƚ'7532"
9690,1,0,"Months passed and suddenly my poor Inn started to become set upon by strange claw marks, and animal howling could be heard in the middle of the night. Grabbing the nearest chair I attacked him but with a sudden few flashes I was suddenly on the floor, holding my severed arm. He cackled and spit at me, calling me a dog, telling me how a fool I was to aid him when he was weak, for now he was strong and he would destroy all who had known him. What happened next I can not say but it is what now brings the scratching and howling to my door. Speaking in words that sounded vile and twisted the banished babbler moved his hands intricately and suddenly spoke in a booming voice, at the stroke of midnight my wonderful Inn would be besieged by bastardly little gremlins. 9697,0,0,"There once was a great scholar and scribe, known by no name but stranger. As far as anyone remembers, he always existed. For a time he wandered the library reading books, stories, scrolls, and conversin with those that made record. His time here was short however, his desire for truth, and knowledge drove him from this place of fancyful writing. Some small notes are all of him that exists. Here I have quoted several of distinct interest to me:

    ""It was written once in a book of lore that the Dark One conjured his avatar. However over time this fact was twisted by scholar and Loremaster alike, until only the great mage Morukai knew the truth of the avatar's being. Many have confused him with the great demon Goru-Nezar.""
    
I am unsure on this record, from my small childhood I was told of a great avatar who walked among us still, I am forbidden to leave these halls, or I would converse with the great one myself, for only he knows the true story, and only he would see through the lies.

    ""Several of man's years have past since the chieftain Kreegak became known, and his band of gnolls. Since that time many were fooled into believing that at one time they had been a great army, rather then the scum they are. Kreegak has been slain many times, but his lord and master Cambron of Blood has summoned his rotted corpse to life and he still lives among those wicked teeth, awaiting the final command.""
    
Of this I am sure, Lord Cambron's puppet Kreegak's soul is no longer on this plane, for our scribes could detect it, but a hole was ripped in those dreaded hills some time ago, a red stain upon the world. Perhaps by some twist of horror he still lives, cold and devoid of his soul, awaiting the order from the Lord of Blood.

Ƚ'7532"
9697,1,0,"    ""The story of the great human city is a sad one, the king, Yeshuz was obsessed with power, and sought any method under the gods to become one with power itself. Zorastra betrayed him, of this I am sure, by accident, or pure vileness, she betrayed him. When the portal was summoned Goru-Nezar, the demonic necromancer from beyond this world was summoned to this plane. He and his minions ravished poor Jurard.""
    
All our scribes have seen the ancient tome written by Kale, our greatest fears have been forged true by the stranger, perhaps the Goru was not the great Avatar after all, perhaps they are all wrong. Could the fabled city of Jurard truly be that forsaken place? No, it couldn't be, that would change everything indeed.

    ""It is thought that when Thrag sealed the barrier no one could break it, it was long after the war of the plague that that giant sealed the road, so that his orcs could fulfill Thrag's father's, Thurath's request for the orcs, goblins, and all the foul things that still remained to destroy Silvermere, to shut them off, and devour them as they sleep. The dwarves of Khazarad fell the barrier with gnomish powder, and Thrag was defeated before he could strike, perhaps we should rejoice, in the name of Kulgar, son of Kulthrek, Lord of the Dwarves I rejoice! HI HO!""
    
At times it strikes me that the stranger mumbled so, perhaps he had lost his mind, or perhaps he had never found it. I can stand and be counted however, as this scroll did not fall on dead eyes, even now Thrag has been joined by a fierce band of orcs, lead by a great Warlord who is nameless by all accounts, though he uses a weapon of the Dark One, a stealer of the life force of any who touches it.

Ƚ'7532"
